info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 9:50PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...BLIZZARD CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE TO MAKE TRAVEL IMPOSSIBLE FOR PORTIONS OF THE NIAGARA FRONTIER THROUGH MIDNIGHT... HAZARDS...The combination of a band of heavy snow and winds gusting to 60 mph is producing BLIZZARD conditions. In this band visibility is ZERO, and there are numerous vehicles stranded on the roadways. DO NOT attempt to travel in this band. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 945 PM EST, a narrow band of very heavy snow was continuing with the northern edge of the band from the city of Buffalo to Williamsville to Akron, and the southern edge from Lackawanna to West Seneca to Alden. The band is expected to remain nearly stationary through midnight. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, Clarence, Lackawanna, Depew, Lancaster, Hamburg, Williamsville, Darien Lakes State Park, Evans, Elma, Marilla, Pembroke, Orchard Park, Akron, Erie Basin Marina, Small Boat Harbor, Alden and Blasdell. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 48A and 57. SAFETY INFO... Travel is impossible in this area, with blizzard conditions. &&
